column1: #Text=Lasithi Plateau is a plateau with avg . altitude 820m in Crete ( Greece ) .
#Text=A rewarding day trip by car from Malia .
#Text=Lasithi Plateau , a mountainous municipality , is the westernmost of the 4 municipalities in Lasithi Prefecture .
#Text=In the south of Lasithi Plateau is the .
#Text=This small plateau is used for shepherding .
#Text=It lacks permanent residents but does have a Byzantine church dedicated to the Holy Spirit .
#Text=The residents of Lasithi Plateau are still influenced by conservative concepts and by the precepts of the Orthodox Church .
#Text=Their attitude toward foreign visitors can vary greatly but is never disrespectful .
#Text=The spoken language is the Cretan idiom of Greek , with additional languages spoken by young people , owners and staff of hotels , tavernas and museums .
#Text=is the capital of the municipality of Lasithi plateau , and the largest also .
#Text=The plateau is accessible through a two paved and some unpaved roads climbing in the slopes of Dikti mountain , so you get'n by car , bus , motocycle , bicycle .
#Text=The most well-known paved road climbs up to 900m , and enters from " seli ampelou " at NNW side of plateau .
#Text=The other paved road , passes from the villages of Mesa and Exo Potamoi , the unpaved roads are known only to the locals

#Text=There 's a paved ring-road that runs the circumference , and serves the 15 villages , the Mesa Lasithaki served by a junction from Mesa Lasithi , other junctions serving the Diktaio Andron , some facilities , and connecting it with the rest of the island 's road network .

#Text=Because the plateau 's economy runs primary on agriculture , an agricultural road network developed for access in the fields , and transporting the loads , recently some of these roads widened & paved making those roads ideal shortcut
#Text=The place where Amalthea is said to have nurtured the infant Zeus with her goat 's milk .
#Text=The cave itself is in a lovely location with breath taking views at the top , but small and unexciting .
#Text=It takes you 15 minutes climbing to get the entrance .
#Text=However you can hire a donkey at 15€ .
#Text=Do n't forget to bring bottled drinking water with you .
#Text=Depending on the time , there are lots of things to do in Lasithi plateau .
#Text=But first of all , forget bathing on the beach !
#Text=1. in the preparations for the potato planting ( late April-early June ) ,
#Text=2. in potato harvesting ( mid-to-late August-mid September ) ,
#Text=Markets ( small , medium , and big ) do exist in ( almost ) every village .

#Text=Except from souvenirs there 's nearly nothing else to buy , however because of first sector economy you can buy potatoes ( Lasithi Plateau produces around 200,000 tonnes of potatoes ) , carrots , cucumbers , etc , directly from the producer , and various types of diary products ( feta , graviera , kefalotyri , athotyros , tirozouli , the Dikti yogurt ) made by the diary ( and from the shepherds too ) from the milk of sheep and goats .
#Text=There are many tavernas and restaurants serving Greek cuisine .
#Text=Τhirstiness strikes hard in this area on hot summer days .
#Text=Fortunately , there are coffee shops and cafes locally .
#Text=The coffee shops are mostly gathering sites for elderly people and the cafes , for younger ones , because they have billiards tables , betting and coin operated PC 's .
#Text=More English is spoken in the cafes .
#Text=Nightlife on the Lasithi Plateau is rare , with only one nightclub open .
#Text=Argoulias Guest house ( In the Village of Tzermiadon ) , ☏ +302844022754 , +30 697 223 4275 ( Mobile phone ) .
#Text=2 studios and 9 stone-built apartments equipped with kitchenette and central heating
#Text=Lasinthos Apartments , " Agios Georgios " Village , ☏ +302844089101 , +30 6932-736626 ( Mobile phone ) .

#Text=Rooms to let near the Dikti cave
#Text=Some villages have a free WiFi Hotspot .
#Text=Some tavernas and cafes also , ask for the code .
#Text=2G , 3G , and 4G are also available if you have data plan
#Text=You will generally be safe if you take normal health and safety precautions for rural areas , with one exception : The greatest danger in this area is falling into open wells .
#Text=For irrigation , wells are opened , with their depth reaching the 16m , so keep children away and approach with caution .
